violations.description: To inflict unnecessary suffering on a sapient being with malicious intent.
violations.title: Animal Cruelty

violations.description: To verbally demean, humiliate, or harass an entity with malice; or maliciously spread false information amongst a population.
violations.title: Harassment

violations.description: To perform the responsibility and duty of a law enforcement official without approval or due cause to act.
violations.title: Vigilantism

violations.description: To deprive an entity of an item in their lawful property without consent.
violations.title: Theft

violations.description: To enter into an area where one is not authorised nor invited.
violations.title: Trespass

violations.description: To deface or superficially damage public property, or property belonging to another person.
violations.title: Vandalism

violations.description: To intentionally and maliciously engage in disruptive conduct, where one refuses to cease.
violations.title: Hooliganism

violations.description: To cause physical harm or to effect unwanted physical contact on a sophont, without the apparent intent to kill them, or to threaten such actions with both capability and intent to do so.
violations.title: Assault

violations.description: To break and enter into a high security area where one is not authorised nor invited, with intent to commit a crime within.
violations.title: Breaking and Entering

violations.description: To partake in an unauthorised riotous, tumultuous, and disruptive public assembly that refuses to disperse after warning.
violations.title: Rioting

violations.description: To recklessly abandon obligations involving the continued wellbeing and/or protection of life and property, through malpractice, action, or inaction.
violations.title: Endangerment

violations.description: To be in unauthorised possession of restricted items or items of particular danger. See Controlled Substances/Items, Controlled Armaments.
violations.title: Possession

violations.description: To wilfully disobey, interfere with, or refuse a decree of the court, warrant, or arrest.
violations.title: Obstruction of Justice

violations.description: To wilfully and maliciously tell an untruth either in court or in the process of making an actionable report to law enforcement.
violations.title: Perjury or False Report

violations.description: To conduct oneself disruptively and disrespectfully before the court.
violations.title: Contempt of Court

violations.description: To maliciously assume the identity of an entity, such as through writing, attire, and/or speech.
violations.title: Identity Theft

violations.description: To act without malice in a manner which, directly or indirectly, leads to the death of a sophont.
violations.title: Manslaughter

violations.description: To unlawfully confine or restrict the free movement of an entity against its will.
violations.title: Kidnapping

violations.description: To be in the possession of a Category C, D, or E Controlled Armament.
violations.title: Grand Possession

violations.description: To unlawfully and maliciously rid a psionic of their powers
violations.title: Mindbreaking

violations.description: To maliciously commit an act that, directly or indirectly, hinders the operation of a vessel of its part; or, to commit an act that modifies and/or damages technology or equipment one is not authorized to access.
violations.title: Sabotage

violations.description: To intentionally misuse or wrongfully exercise one's own authority, influence, or control, resulting in harm, unjust treatment, or demonstratable loss to another entity.
violations.title: Abuse of Power

violations.description: To deprive an entity of any Controlled Item in their lawful possession.
violations.title: Grand Larceny

violations.description: To sell, distribute, or otherwise circulate Controlled Items to unauthorized entities.
violations.title: Black Marketeering

violations.description: To maliciously commit an act resulting in the death of a sophont, with reckless indifference to their life.
violations.title: Murder

violations.description: To maliciously commit an act or take hostages with reckless indifference to life in order to provoke a state of terror in, intimidate, or otherwise compel an entity to act or abstain from acting.
violations.title: Terrorism

violations.description: To maliciously commit an act that, directly or indirectly, renders a vessel or its part uninhabitable or inoperable; or, to commit an act that causes irreversible damage to High Security Areas and/or systems of a vessel.
violations.title: Grand Sabotage

violations.description: To commit an act that prevents the revival of a sophont by standard medical care following their death.
violations.title: Prevention of Revival

violations.description: To act to overthrow a lawfully established Chain of Command or governing body without lawful or legitimate cause.
violations.title: Sedition

violations.description: To escape the custody of law enforcement while serving a legal sentence, or awaiting trial for a capital offense.
violations.title: Breach of Custody
